moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1
comment: This sacks a pawn by ignoring black's 'threat'.  However white gets extremely dangerous compensation.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6

1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5
comment: The idea is to shatter black's pawn structure without clearing the second rank, as Bxg6 would, for defense.  It is unclear if it is winning, but it's definitely the correct way to proceed at this point.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5 Re7
comment: This may have been too pessimistic. Black opts to exchange some pieces in hopes of a draw.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5 Re7 24. Rxe7 Nxe7 25. Bd3 Nf5 26. Bxf5 gxf5 27. Re1
comment: With the idea of Re1-e3-g3+, and this also stops escape along the e-file in some cases.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5 Re7 24. Rxe7 Nxe7 25. Bd3 Nf5 26. Bxf5 gxf5 27. Re1 Qxa2 28. Qxh6 a3
comment: It isn't hard to see why black was attracted to this position; he is putting his faith in the a-P. Karpov must be very accurate.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5 Re7 24. Rxe7 Nxe7 25. Bd3 Nf5 26. Bxf5 gxf5 27. Re1 Qxa2 28. Qxh6 a3 29. Qg5+ Kf8 30. Qf6 Kg8 31. Qxf5
comment: First off, black cannot move the Q from a2 with check.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5 Re7 24. Rxe7 Nxe7 25. Bd3 Nf5 26. Bxf5 gxf5 27. Re1 Qxa2 28. Qxh6 a3 29. Qg5+ Kf8 30. Qf6 Kg8 31. Qxf5 Qd2 32. Re7
comment: Secondly, black's R must spend a tempo coming to the passive f8-square.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 c5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Ngf3 a6 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Nb3 Bb6 8. Bd3 Ne7 9. O-O Nbc6 10. Re1 Bg4 11. c3 h6 12. h3 Bh5 13. Be3 O-O 14. Bxb6 Qxb6 15. Qe2 Rfd8 16. Rad1 a5 17. Bb1 Bxf3 18. Qxf3 a4 19. Nd4 Qxb2 20. Nxc6 Nxc6 21. Qf5 g6 22. Qf6 Rd7 23. Bf5 Re7 24. Rxe7 Nxe7 25. Bd3 Nf5 26. Bxf5 gxf5 27. Re1 Qxa2 28. Qxh6 a3 29. Qg5+ Kf8 30. Qf6 Kg8 31. Qxf5 Qd2 32. Re7 Rf8 33. Qg4+ Kh7 34. Re5 Qh6 35. Rh5 Ra8 36. Qf5+ Kg7 37. Rxh6 Kxh6 38. Qf6+ Kh7 39. Qxf7+ Kh8 40. Qxb7
comment: Karpov's precise play yields big dividends. Black cannot even keep his R on the a-file.  Vaganian resigned.
